title._content: ["Burrwood," Walter Jennings house, Cold Spring Harbor, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Burrwood," Walter Jennings house, Cold Spring Harbor, New York. Sunken garden and pathway] [1916] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Carrère & Hastings, 1898-1900 with changes in 1915. Landscape: Frederick Law Olmsted and Olmsted Brothers, from 1895, worked from 1915-1916 at time of additions to house; Hicks Nurseries. Associated Name: Jean Brown (Mrs. Walter) Jennings. Other: House and garden on 110 acres. Today: Garden not extant except some walls and a gate, house razed. On slide (handwritten): "J" and "Jennings, Mrs. Walter, Cold Spring Harbor." Also, gold star sticker and red line stroke. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 66. Subjects: Gardens--New York (State)--Cold Spring Harbor--1910-1920. Walkways--New York (State)--Cold Spring Harbor--1910-1920. Sculpture--New York (State)--Cold Spring Harbor--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1910-1920. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16210 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 1
